entry.def: If you describe someone or something as Germanic, you think that their appearance or behaviour is typical of German people or things.

example.ex: He asked in his Germanic English if I was enjoying France.
example.tran: 他操着一口带有德国腔的英语问我在法国玩得是否愉快。

entry.tran: 日耳曼文化的；日耳曼语的
entry.def: Germanic is used to describe the ancient culture and language of the peoples of northern Europe.

example.tran: 基督教创立之前定居在欧洲的日耳曼部落

means.word_mean: 1. a branch of the Indo-European family of languages; members that are spoken currently fall into two major groups: Scandinavian and West Germanic
1. of or relating to the language of Germans;
2. of or pertaining to the ancient Teutons or their languages;

sentences.sentence: "Teutonic peoples such as Germans and Scandinavians and British"

means.word_mean: 3. of a more or less German nature; somewhat German;

sentences.en: English derives in the main from the common Germanic stock.
